clean_content:
Definition / general

* Odontoameloblastoma (OA) is / was viewed as an extremely rare mixed odontogenic tumor with both epithelial and mesenchymal components
  + Epithelial component represented by ameloblastoma+ Mesenchymal component - a compound or complex odontoma* Not considered an entity in the current 4th edition WHO ([El-Naggar: WHO Classification of Head and Neck Tumours, 4th Edition, 2017](https://www.amazon.com/exec/obidos/ASIN/9283224388/pathologyoutl-20))

Essential features

* Odontoameloblastoma (OA) is no longer considered an entity in the current 4th edition WHO ([El-Naggar: WHO Classification of Head and Neck Tumours, 4th Edition, 2017](https://www.amazon.com/exec/obidos/ASIN/9283224388/pathologyoutl-20))

Terminology

* Odontoblastoma* Adamant-odontoma* Calcified mixed odontogenic tumor* Soft and calcified odontoma* Ameloblastic odontoma

Epidemiology

* Wide age range (2 - 50 years) with mean age of ~20 years ([Oral Oncol 2002;38:800](12570061))* Slight male predilection

Sites

* Molar / premolar region of maxilla or mandible

Clinical features

* Swelling, dull pain, delayed eruption of teeth, bone expansion

Diagnosis

* Diagnosis dependent on clinical, radiologic and pathologic correlation

Radiology description

* Radiolucent lesion that can be destructive
  + Contains calcified structures resembling mature dental tissue

Radiology images

Images hosted on other servers:  

[![](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/thumb/mandiblemaxillaodontoameloblastoma_nih01.jpg)](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC4672545/figure/Fig1/)
 
[![](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/thumb/mandiblemaxillaodontoameloblastoma_nih02.jpg)](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC4672545/figure/Fig2/)

Cystic lesion

[![](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/thumb/mandiblemaxillaodontoameloblastoma_nih03.jpg)](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC3125659/figure/F0004/)

Diffuse foci of radiopacities

Prognostic factors

* Known to recur after curettage* No long term prognostic data, given so few cases

Case reports

* 11 year old Japanese boy with a painless and large mass of the right maxillary region ([J Med Case Rep 2015;9:278](26643809))* 12 year old Caucasian girl referred for occasional pain and gingival swelling ([Med Oral 2004;9:340](15292874))* 12 year old boy with mass in upper jaw ([Case of the Week #367](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/caseofweek/case367.htm))* 17 year old girl with odontoameloblastoma resembling a fibro-osseous lesion ([J Oral Maxillofac Pathol 2015;19:251](26604505))* 47 year old man with a chief complaint of rapidly growing swelling on the back side of the anterior lower jaw for 3 months ([J Oral Maxillofac Pathol 2011;15:60](21731280))

Treatment

* Suggested to treat similarly to [ameloblastoma](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/mandiblemaxillaameloblastoma.html#treatment15968)

Gross images

Images hosted on other servers:  

[![](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/thumb/mandiblemaxillaodontoameloblastoma_nih04.jpg)](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC4672545/figure/Fig4/)

Surgical specimens

Microscopic (histologic) description

* Proliferating odontogenic epithelium portion identical to that of an ameloblastoma with peripheral palisading, reverse polarization and stellate reticulum
  + Generally presenting as plexiform or follicular pattern* This epithelial portion appears intermingled with dental tissues of variable degrees of maturity
    + Can show resemblance to the developing rudimentary teeth, as in a compound odontoma+ Can also show conglomerate masses of enamel, dentin and cementum, as seen in complex odontoma

Microscopic (histologic) images

Contributed by David Cohen, M.B.B.Ch., M.D. ([Case #367](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/caseofweek/case367.htm))  

[![Case of the Week #367](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/caseofweek/case367image1.jpg)](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/caseofweek/case367image1.jpg)
 
[![Case of the Week #367](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/caseofweek/case367image2.jpg)](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/caseofweek/case367image2.jpg)
 
[![Case of the Week #367](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/caseofweek/case367image3.jpg)](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/caseofweek/case367image3.jpg)

Case of the Week #367

[![Various images](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/thumb/mandiblemaxillaodontoameloblastoma_nih05.jpg)](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC4672545/figure/Fig5/)
 
[![Various images](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/thumb/mandiblemaxillaodontoameloblastoma_nih06.jpg)](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC4611937/figure/F3/)

Various images

[![Odontogenic epithelial cells](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/thumb/mandiblemaxillaodontoameloblastoma_nih07.jpg)](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC3125659/figure/F0005/)

Odontogenic epithelial cells

[![Irregular masses of dysplastic dentin](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/thumb/mandiblemaxillaodontoameloblastoma_nih08.jpg)](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC3125659/figure/F0011/)

Irregular masses of dysplastic dentin

Differential diagnosis

* [Ameloblastic fibroma](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/mandiblemaxillaameloblasticfibroma.html)
  + Composed of odontogenic epithelial component strands, cords and islands that may exhibit peripheral palisading, reverse polarization and stellate reticulum+ Primitive appearing stroma that is delicate and lobular in appearance+ Should not have the mesenchymal (odontoma) component* [Ameloblastic fibro-odontoma](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/mandiblemaxillaodontoma.html)
    + Has soft tissue component that is similar to ameloblastic fibroma+ Also contains a calcifying component composed of enamel and dentin structures* [Ameloblastoma](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/mandiblemaxillaameloblastoma.html)
      + Same histologic epithelial features with peripheral palisading, reverse polarization and stellate reticulum+ Should not have mixed mesenchymal component (odontoma)* [Calcifying cystic odontogenic tumor (CCOT)](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/mandiblemaxillacalcifyingodontogenic.html)
        + Benign cystic tumor of odontogenic origin, also known as Gorlin cyst or calcifying odontogenic cyst+ Can have ameloblastic features: columnar or cuboidal basal cells with lumen lined by tissue resembling stellate reticulum+ Will have ghost cells or anucleate epithelial cells+ Can also have dentinoid materal resembling odontoma in around 20% of cases* [Odontoma](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/mandiblemaxillaodontoma.html)
          + Compound odontoma: cluster of denticles of varying sizes+ Complex odontoma: conglomerate of dentin admixed with enamel matrix
